snippet.title: Dramatic arrest on Industrial Drive
snippet.content:
A POLICE chase that began in Port Stephens has ended with a dramatic arrest in front of scores of motorists on Industrial Drive. A wanted man, 19, was pulled over in Medowie about 9.15am in a Holden sedan. However, police said as they approached the car, the Holden started to reverse, "striking one officer and causing minor injuries". A police officer attempted to stop the car, but was unsuccessful, with the driver accelerating away, a statement said.
A pursuit ensued but was terminated by police in Williamtown due to safety concerns. A short time later, police located the Holden in Mayfield, but the car broke down on Industrial Drive.
With the driver's luck running out, it is alleged he made a dash on foot and attempted to enter the cab of a truck. Police allege he assaulted the truck driver. Police said the 19-year-old was pulled from the vehicle and arrested. The driver's passengers, a 20-year-old woman and a 17-year-old boy, were earlier arrested. The woman and the boy were released without charge. The 19-year-old was taken to hospital with minor injuries.
He is expected to be charged with a number of outstanding warrants and other offences.
